abstracts.cdata!:
The Decentralized Rural Infrastructure
            Project for Peru aims at improving access of rural
            households and entrepreneurs to goods, social services and
            income generating opportunities through reduced transport
            costs and better rural transport infrastructure and through
            piloting, in 15 provinces, specific incentives aiming at
            promoting greater complementarities and bundling of rural
            infrastructure interventions at the provincial level. The
            closing date for the project will be extended from March 31,
            2012 until March 31, 2013. The project has been implemented
            at a relatively accelerated pace and has currently disbursed
            US$42.8million (86 percent of the Loan amount of US$50
            million). Civil works, in particular for the rehabilitation
            component, have been implemented at 93 percent of completion
            rate while institutional strengthening activities have been
            slower at 62 percent for the development of the local
            capacity and 23 percent in policy and regulation. The
            project has been impacted in recent years due to the
            regional and national elections that took place (in 2010 and
            2011) resulting in a significant number of changes in
            provincial administrations, including changes in technical
            staff of the Provincial Road Institutes. The extension is
            necessary to allow for the project activities to be
            completed and achieve its objectives during the proposed
            extended implementation period. The Borrower has in place an
            action plan to monitor project progress and complete the
            project by March 31, 2013. This will be the first extension
            of the project.
